alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 08 at 2:39AM MST until December 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...More snow is expected to develop today. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches expected, with isolated totals up to a foot possible, mainly for the Sierra Madres. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Mountain travel could become dangerous or impossible due to icy, snow packed roads and low visibilities in falling snow. Hikers and snowmobilers may easily become disoriented. Remember, frostbite and hypothermia can develop quickly.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
